name: Tereschenko Family
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to The commemorative coin “Tereschenko Family” with the face value of 10 hryvnias is dedicated to the famous Ukrainian Tereschenko family that has its origin in Hlukhiv, a renowned city of Ukrainian Cossackdom, and left a deep imprint on the history of Ukraine. The Tereschenkos have always adhered to the motto of their coat of arms – “Aspiring to the Public Benefit”, being well-known entrepreneurs and generous patrons of the arts.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine and the semicircular inscription Національний банк України (National Bank of Ukraine) (above); under the inscription there are designation of the metal and its finenness – Ag 925, and the weight in fineness – 31.1 (on the right) as well as the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint (on the left). In the coin center there is placed the monogram with Mykola Tereschenko’s initials; beneath there are the face value of the coin and the year of its issue – 10 гривень/2008 (10 hryvnias/2008).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse against the background of symbolical attributes embodying activities of Tereschenko family representatives there are the portraits of such vivid personalities from the family as Artemii, Mykola, Varvara and Fedir; to the right there are the coat of arms of the family and the legend Родина Терещинків (family of the Tereschenkos).
